oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Pvt. James Hoots Call, Co. C, 44th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reproduction full-length portrait of James Hoots Call wearing double-breasted frock coat and campaign hat. Because of an arm wound sustained at Shiloh, he was discharged from service in June 1862 at age 35. Family lore states that Call carried a minie ball in his body for the rest of his life. He was born in Lincoln County and related to the family that sold Jack Daniel's Distillery. Discharge papers photocopied.
